required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effects of Individualized Oxygen Dynamic on Prognosis of Patients With High-risk Cardiac Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Perioperative Goal-Directed Therapy Based on Individualized Oxygen Balance on Outcomes During High-risk Cardiac Surgery:A Single Center, Prospective,Randomized,Controlled,Double Blinded Study.

lead_sponsor.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital of Anhui Medical University

clinical_study.source: The First Affiliated Hospital of Anhui Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: Anesthesia-related factors have been linked to poor perioperative outcomes. Our observational study suggested that the cumulative duration of a triple-low state [intraoperative low mean arterial pressure (MAP), low bispectral index (BIS), and low target effect-site concentration(Ce) ]was associated with poorer 30-day mortality.This randomized, prospective study based on individualized Oxygen dynamics is designed to confirm this association in high-risk patients cardiopulmonary bypass (CPB).

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Interventional group:MAP declined with less than 20% of baseline, BIS 45-60 before and after CPB; and BIS 40-45 during CPB, Brain oxygen saturation declined with less than 20% of baseline. Control groupï¼šno intervention beside the same monitoring with MAP, BIS and brain oxygen saturation and receiving standard measures to achieve a heart rate (HR) in the range of 60-100 beats/min, central venous oxygen saturation (Svco2) higher than 70%, lactate level lower than 3 mmol/L, hematocrit value higher than 28%, and urinary output higher than 0.5 mL/kg/hr.
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)
study_design_info.masking_description: Patients were followed up by an investigator unaware of the patients' achievement or not of the oxygen dynamic goal

primary_outcome.measure: Major postoperative complications(i.e., Rate of low cardiac output syndrome, stroke, myocardial ischemia, infection,reoperation, and need for dialysis)
primary_outcome.description: Number of Participants with major complications extracted after 30-day follow-up
Data for duration of postoperative 30-day all-cause mortality

primary_outcome.measure: The change of incidence of postoperative delirium
primary_outcome.description: Through Confusion Assessment Method (CAM)to assess the incidence of the postoperative delirium
Data for duration of 1,3,5-year all-cause mortality is extracted after 1-year follow-up

secondary_outcome.description: Data for duration of postoperative hospital stay is extracted after 30-day follow-up

secondary_outcome.measure: The change of incidence of postoperative cognition dysfunction
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 day before surgery, the 3,7 day after the surgery
secondary_outcome.description: The neuropsychological tests performed at the day before the surgery,the 3,7 day after the surgery respectively.
Data for duration of the occurrence of cardiovascular events is extracted 30-day follow-up

secondary_outcome.measure: The incidence of any adverse events
secondary_outcome.description: Including kidney or brain related adverse events 30-day after surgery

arm_group.description: The goal of intervention:mean artery pressure declined with less than 20% of baseline, BIS 45-60 before and after CPB; and BIS 40-45 during CPB, Brain oxygen saturation declined with less than 20% of baseline.

no intervention beside the same monitoring with MAP, BIS and brain oxygen saturation and receiving standard measures to achieve a heart rate (HR) in the range of 60-100 beats/min, central venous oxygen saturation (Svco2) higher than 70%, lactate level lower than 3 mmol/L, hematocrit value higher than 28%, and urinary output higher than 0.5 mL/kg/hr.

intervention.description: mean artery pressure declined with less than 20% of baseline
BIS 45-60 before and after CPB; and BIS 40-45 during CPB
Brain oxygen saturation declined with less than 20% of baseline

receiving standard measures to achieve a heart rate (HR) in the range of 60-100 beats/min, central venous oxygen saturation (Svco2) higher than 70%, lactate level lower than 3 mmol/L, hematocrit value higher than 28%, and urinary output higher than 0.5 mL/kg/hr.

facility.name: The First Affiliated Hospital of Anhui Medical University
